intro: Psychotria rubiginosissima, commonly known as the red-stained psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It is often found in shaded, humid environments within the understory of tropical rainforests. The species is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though its medicinal properties remain under study.
